text: Golding, Ole Miss edge Georgia, will meet Miami - ESPN
fullText: With a field goal and a safety in the final minute of the fourth quarter, Ole Miss defeated Georgia 39-34 in the Sugar Bowl to advance to the College Football Playoff semifinals against Miami.

text: Woman killed in suspected mountain lion attack while hiking in northern Colorado - ABC News
fullText: A woman was killed in a suspected mountain lion attack while she was hiking alone in the mountains of northern Colorado

text: Tommy Lee Jones’ daughter found dead at San Francisco hotel, reports say - San Francisco Chronicle
fullText: Victoria Jones, the daughter of actor Tommy Lee Jones, was found dead at San Francisco’s Fairmont Hotel on New Year’s Day, according to reports.

text: Japan PM joins fight for more female toilets in parliament - BBC
fullText: Japan's parliament building was built in 1936, a decade before women were given the right to vote.

text: Indiana throttles Alabama: Hoosiers leave no doubt en route to CFP semifinal berth vs. Oregon - CBS Sports
fullText: Indiana looked every bit the part of a No. 1 seed in a dominant victory over Alabama in the Rose Bowl College Football Playoff quarterfinal

text: Catholic influencer's 5-year-old son dies after 11-day flu battle followed by thousands - Fox News
fullText: Paul J. Kim announced his 5-year-old son Micah died after severe flu that turned septic and caused seizures after an 11-day hospital battle documented on social media.

text: 5 takeaways from Trump's defiant WSJ interview on his health - Axios
fullText: Trump told the WSJ he had a CT scan during a recent medical exam and not an MRI scan, as he previously claimed.

text: Will Smith sued over allegations he retaliated against violinist who reported sexual harassment - NBC News
fullText: A violinist accused Will Smith of retaliation after he said he was fired for reporting sexual harassment while on tour with the actor and rapper, according to a lawsuit filed earlier this week

text: McGuire: TTU not using layoff as excuse for loss - ESPN
fullText: Texas Tech's Joey McGuire didn't use the team's layoff ahead of Thursday's game as an excuse, instead pointing to inefficient early-down execution and costly turnovers as the primary reasons for a loss to "the best defense we've faced" in Oregon.

text: Why everything from your phone to your PC may get pricier in 2026 - BBC
fullText: The price of Ram - once one of the cheapest computer parts - has more than doubled since October 2025.

text: ‘Stranger Things 5’: Duffer Brothers Unpack Emotional Series Finale From [SPOILER]’s Death To That 40-Minute Epilogue, Those Needle Drops & A Spinoff Hint - Deadline

text: Tipster reveals 10 spectacular upgrades for the Galaxy S26 Ultra - PhoneArena

text: Deaths reported during widening protests in Iran sparked by ailing economy - NPR
fullText: The protests began due to economic pressures, with Iran's currency rapidly depreciating. Demonstrators have also chanted against the country's theocracy.

text: Este Haim Tied the Knot on New Year’s Eve at a Star-Studded Ceremony - Rolling Stone
fullText: Este Haim married tech entrepreneur Jonathan Levin on New Year's Eve in California in a swanky ceremony.

text: Yemen: Separatists allow Saudi-backed forces in seized areas - DW
fullText: A UAE-backed group pushing for independence in southern Yemen has agreed to the deployment of Saudi-aligned forces in the oil-rich territory it seized last month.

text: Congress failed to extend Obamacare subsidies. This Democrat says Trump can save them - NPR
fullText: Sen. Peter Welch, D-Vt., says he thinks the Senate can pass a "retroactive" Affordable Care Act subsidy extension, but "we need President Trump."

text: Response to China’s Military Exercise Near Taiwan - U.S. Department of State (.gov)
fullText: China’s military activities and rhetoric toward Taiwan and others in the region increase tensions unnecessarily. We urge Beijing to exercise restraint, cease its military pressure against Taiwan, and instead engage in meaningful dialogue. The United States su…

text: January’s full wolf supermoon and the Quadrantid meteor shower will start off the new year - CNN
fullText: Catch the wolf supermoon and Quadrantid meteor shower as January’s night sky puts on a celestial double feature.
